bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of Document.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: Filed Jany 17. 1869 J.B. Condon Clerk by R.B Shawn Dept. Clerk
To all whom these presents shall come, Greeting:

Know ye that wheras at a term of the District Court of the United States in and for the Territory of Washington in the First Judicial District held at the City of Walla Walla, in the County of Walla Walla in said District on the first Monday the thrid day of April in the year of our Lord on thousand eight hundered and sixty five before the Honerable James E Wyche, presiding Judge of said District at a suit of the territory of Washington, William Adams was convicted of Robery and sentenced to serve in the Penitentiary at hard labor for life at the expense of the Territory. And whereas representations have been made to me in behalf of the said William Adams favorably recommending him as an object of execution clemency

Now therefore I William Pickering Governer of Washington Territory in consideration of the promises and by virtue of the power vested in me by law have granted and do hereby grant unto the said William Adams a Pardon of the offenses of which he stands convicted as aforesaid upon condition that he leave the territory within forty days from the date and never return within it's limits.

Therefore upon his complying with the above condition of hereby direct that he be forthwith released from his imprisonment. In testimony whereof I have here unto set my hand and caused the seal of the Territory to be affixed at Olympia this fifteenth day of December in the year of our Lord one thousand eight-hundred and sixty six.
William Pickering Governer of Washington Territory
